intro: Psychotria torrei, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Psychotria torrei contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which has significant pharmacological and illicit uses. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also of interest in ethnobotanical and medicinal research.
